headline: Amazing work culture

1. Good mentorship - As i have joined as a fresher, initial weeks were bootcamp. i was just learning new and exciting stuff with great mentors(still i am). Most people here are ready to help and mentor you whenever you want. Everyone is approachable, no boss employee culture.

2. latest technology - As UC is a fast growing company, you would be growing also very fast. you will learn latest technologies and also will get to know the pros and cons for each. it is a complete learning experience.

3. Culture - UC has many culture values. i like 'bias for action' and 'ownership' the most. it feels good when your work makes an impact and you are owner of that. Apart from that work life balance is good most of the times. company takes care of employees. 

4. Company's mission is to be a category defining company and impact million of lives in a good way. you will also learn things outside tech if you are interested.

Basically you will have a great work culture, amazing learning experience in a good mentorship with a good work life balance most of the times. visit careers.urbancompany.com to know more about culture and insights of UC.

headline: Engineering - Great startup to enhance career growth
pros:
* The complete tech stack is on JS (React, Vue) so you can become a JS expert
* You can try your hand at other technologies like Kotlin (Android)/Swift (iOS)
* If you want to take ownership of complete modules or services from early on, you'll fit well
* Day-to-day interactions with Product team - how they are approaching a problem and what metrics could one achieve with the particular feature/enhancement
* Good environment with co-workers willing to help each other out (just have to sit with them sometimes and blocking the calendar doesn't work)
* Pod culture is followed wherein a member from each client (frontend) and a couple of guys from backend work together to build a feature along with a team lead
* Lastly,  it's a well established startup now and only growing at a fast pace and so one can observe the amazing VPs & AVPs seeking to reach new growth heights
cons:
* Many a times last minute iterations are involved in design and product which leads to unplanned execution during final days of release
* Collaboration among different verticals like Business & Engineering is a little difficult sometimes since each have their own targets and timelines
* Unwarranted pressure from different stakeholders in a few instances
* No benefits or such on services for employees - even during festivals
* Only decent compensation

They just want things done only to change it later after a week acting on their own whims and so-called "data-analysis" by product managers (as they don't really have that big customer base and people really struggle to even get on the platform).
The model of their business is very complex (which is not required) and they even keep on even changing it say in a month or so. This certainly impacts the work of developers. In simple words, they are not sure what is to be made and would curse the developer that he didn't think it through before developing it and would curse even more if you go back to discuss it. Everybody just plays blame game and no one would take responsibility. Appraisals are purely based on fawning.
Most of the reviews (on services they provide as well as job reviews on glassdoor) are FAKE! As they would politely ask you to review them good when you join them  (even the interns). Most people would do it as they are yet to go permanent.
Also, they take the utmost pride in these fake reviews and ads that they make and trick themselves to think that the company is flourishing.

There are a couple of jobs which I considered were dream jobs for me but only 2-3 months after joining this place I realized that I cannot work anywhere else now. I have seen and heard from a lot of friends in other startups that their founders at such stage have started taking customer or partner experiences and loyalty very lightly or have become too disconnected and indifferent about the fundamentals of a business. But this company is lucky to have the 3 founders that we have.
cons: Not a place for free-riders or fence sitters. Very high energy and very fast pace of execution. If you want to make it big in life then this is the place, but if you are not so ambitious about your career then this place might not be the ideal place for you and small sacrifices or long hard working days is necessary to build something legendary.

headline: Great Company to work for
pros:
What Urbanclap does: A good job isn't just about the pay check or big brand . Many people want to feel like their work is contributing to the greater good of the world. so for me urban clap is the place to be. They are solving one of the biggest problem in Indian metros. Ensuring discovery and "quality" of services. Making service profession accountable to what they deliver. 

Kind of work: Too Cool !! There is so much work to be done. A technology team of 25-30 is dealing with  challenging and exciting problems every day. Its fun to brainstorm them and try out different solutions. Its like I am totally free to pick a problem I like and experiment with it. Ofcourse there is regular work to be done too, but I always know why I am doing it and there is no one fixed way to do it, so its never boring.

Sky rocketing learning: 2 month seem like a year already ! . Complete ownership.

Culture: Work hard , party hard. Flexible. No hierarchies, minimal reporting system. Completely ownership and result driven. Co-founders work with you on day to day basis. Lots of acknowledgement for good work. Regular employee feedbacks. One on One with HR once a month to ensure you are happy. Jam sessions for people with guitars. Chill Friday evenings. team trips. mixers with other teams. launch parties and many other things to make life fun. 

Peers: Every one is hand picked and smart. Young , productive and people you can learn from. All discussion are very constructive and helpful.
cons:
Long working hours: Though I enjoy it because the work is fun and there is so much ownership. But 10-12 hours minimum are needed. Support on weekend might also be needed sometimes. 
Since its a start up workplace it not very comfortable. they are improving it but slowly.
